title: Organizational Change Management Specialist
description:
Department: Human ResourcesReports To: Associate Director Total RewardsTravel Required: 25% 
Why Join Community Coffee? Community Coffee Company is the #1 family-owned and operated retail coffee brand in America. Rooted in family and tradition, yet always looking to the future, you can expect a fast-paced environment that is both challenging and rewarding. Join us and make your passion your profession!

Position Overview
The Organizational Change Management Specialist ensures success for projects within the organization by creating a smooth transition for the employee experience thereby increasing employee adoption and usage and minimizing interruption to business. This role plans for and fosters the success of the people side of changes that come with projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, preparing, supporting and equipping people to efficiently adopt change through strategies and plans that maximize adoption and usage of the required changes while minimizing resistant behaviors.
Function Related Activities/Key Responsibilities
Lead change management activities through the implementation of processes and tools that support adoption of changes required by a project.Support communication of projects through the creation and delivery of change management communications.Analyze the impact of changes and assess change readiness.Identify, analyze, and prepare risk mitigation strategies.Anticipate, plan for, analyze and manage resistance to change.Support and engage stakeholders, leadership, and project managers.Collaborate with team to support changes to organizational design through definition of roles.Ensure change management tasks are integrated into the main project plan.Define and measure success metrics and monitor change progress.Manage the change portfolio. This includes but is not limited to identifying issues that arise as a result of implementing various (sometimes simultaneous) changes within the organization.Develop tools for use by the organization to help manage change for smaller projects.May be asked to perform additional duties as necessary.
Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree from a four-year accredited college or university in Business, Human Resources Management or related field.5 year’s experience in Human Resources or 3 years’ experience in Organizational Change Management required. Experience in Organizational Change Management preferred.Experience with Community Coffee, even if unrelated, may fulfill this requirement at the discretion of the hiring manager with approval from Human Resources.Ability to interact with all levels of management and across a variety of functional areas.Ability to apply business acumen to identify issues and innovative solutions to support business objectives.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written, verbal).Ability to maintain a high degree of confidentiality.
Physical Demands/Work EnvironmentThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to do the following:Frequently required to sitOccasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls and reach with hands and arms; and talk or hearRegularly required to lift and/or move up to 25 poundsSpecific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus

title: Director of Workforce Development
description:
Job Title: Director of Workforce Development with Continual Opportunities for Growth!
Job Description: DSDT is looking for a strategic and dynamic individual to serve as the bridge that connects our students with employment opportunities.
About DSDT: DSDT is a licensed, post-secondary school that provides training in the Digital Marketing, Information Technology and Healthcare sectors. Founded in 2009, DSDT offers an innovative, student-focused and collaborative learning environment. We meet students where they are at. Every time.
What it’s Like to Work Here: Our team members all share a go-getter attitude, problem solving abilities and empathy, enabling us to help students succeed and maintain a positive work environment. We support each other and get things done.
About the Role: As the bridge between our students and the corporate world, your skills will help our students be the best professionals they can be.
Strategic Partnerships: Through continual communication and attending job fairs/networking events, you will forge strategic relationships with companies. These relationships will look like companies hosting our students for externships and hiring for full-time positions, companies paying us for corporate training and companies sending their employees to our school with tuition assistance programs.
Student Empowerment: You will host weekly professional development seminars for our students to become more employable and confident in their skills. Seminars can be, but are not limited to, resume writing, mock interviews and soft skills training.
Data Entry: You will meticulously track employment information for our graduates to ensure accurate reports.
Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in related field2-4 years of professional experienceStrong ability to forge strategic relationships with corporate partnersEmpowering mindset that encourages students to achieve their goalsUnderstanding of the technology industry and what companies are looking forExcellent written and verbal communication skills

If this sounds like you, apply to join our team! Cover letters aren’t required but are recommended and can be emailed to hunter.gadwell@dsdt.edu. Salary is negotiable. We’ll be in touch soon.

title: Marketing/Promotions Coordinator
description:
About Us:Boise State University is located along the banks of the Boise River and a short stroll from the state capitol. We are committed to an innovative, transformative, and equitable educational environment that supports student success, and advances Idaho and the world.
Boise State is building an inclusive community of faculty and staff whose unique skills, cultural contributions, work history, and perspectives create a rich and rewarding academic experience for our students. Applications from individuals of all backgrounds and identities are welcomed.
Learn more about Boise State and living in Idaho’s Treasure Valley at https://www.boisestate.edu/about/
Job Summary/Basic Function:Advances and protects Boise State’s institutional identity by assisting in the development and implementation of marketing plans, advertisements, special projects, website management, social media management and graphic design. Creates, coordinates, implements and analyzes marketing and communication directed at relevant audiences.
This position may have the opportunity to work hybrid where a mix of in-person work from a Boise State worksite and an alternative work location is utilized. Candidates must be able to work on-site as needed.
Department Overview:The Division of Extended Studies is on a mission to extend higher education beyond traditional boundaries. Our collaborative teams expand student access and improve student success with innovative programs that reach across our metropolitan area, Idaho and beyond. We facilitate online education, community-based programs, concurrent enrollment at high schools, summer sessions, continuing education programs and other lifelong learning options. Join us!
The Marketing and Communications team, within the Division of Extended Studies, focuses on the awareness and promotion of Boise State Online and programs supported by the Division of Extended Studies. The team is composed of professionals with a variety of skill sets spanning creative, marketing and content development. The team draws on these diverse talents to collaboratively achieve goals.
Level Scope:Fully competent and productive professional contributor who applies acquired job skills, policies, and procedures to complete substantive assignments/projects/tasks of moderate scope and complexity. Works independently with general supervision; exercises judgment within defined guidelines and practices to determine appropriate action. May provide guidance and assistance to entry level professionals and/or support employees. Typically hold a Bachelor’s Degree and 2 years of professional experience or equivalent relevant experience.
Essential Functions:● Oversee messaging and content posted to various social media platforms.● Serve as an advocate for the university and act in the best interest of the university inestablishing a level of quality and production associated with university events.● Maintain professional flexibility to accommodate rapidly changing processes, program information and priorities.● Make recommendations and implement social media best practices.● Demonstrate a strong ability to manage, coordinate, and deliver on concepts and information to effectively maximize theuniversity’s brand.● Collaborate closely with a variety of stakeholders, both internal and external, on all aspects of projects, including planning,content, layout and publication of marketing materials, turnaround time, etc.● Develop timelines to ensure publishing of media is completed as required and the content and delivery is appropriately planned for target audience.● Possesses social perceptiveness and orientation to facilitate diverse, inclusive and culturally sensitive working and learning environments to serve global audiences.● Assess, strategies, prepare and communicate the best practices for usability.● Write content for multiple placements. Format, edit and review content and photos for final placement with consideration of engagement goals, best practices and user experience.● Develop and manage written content for web and through customer relationship management systems.● Manage and maintain creative content and design templates used for asset development.● Maintain consistency in new content development.● Create impactful content, including student stories, press releases, emails, blogs, etc. to promote Boise State Online programs.● Perform other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:● Ability to generate, cultivate and maintain business relationships with corporate community, maintain a high level of communication skills and work well with a diverse group of people.● Must be able to work independently, make decisions and problem solve.● Ability to compose written material with a succinct message and free of spelling or grammatical errors.● Good knowledge of: developing and implementing communication and marketing plans, creative direction and social media best practices.● Experience: implementing marketing and advertising plans as well as computer literacy and producing graphics for many aspects of media; using creative suites software.
Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree and 2 years experience or equivalent.
Preferred Qualifications:● One (1) year higher education experience.● Excellent attention to detail in all aspects of writing and communication (e.g. effective storytelling, grammar, spelling, and punctuation).● Knowledge of current and emerging marketing trends and best practices in the higher education industry and beyond.● Proficient skills in creating content.
Salary and Benefits:Salary of $47,195.20/yr; commensurate with experience. Boise State University is committed to offering a benefits package that provides health and financial protection plans as well as resources to promote health and well-being. Our program provides flexibility so you can choose the benefits that are right for you and your family. Learn more about our benefit options at https://www.boisestate.edu/hrs/benefits/.
Required Application Materials:● Resume● Cover Letter● 3 Work samples that showcase writing and social media abilities

title: Senior IT Project Manager
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they are doing. At Dutch Bros Coffee, we are more than just a coffee company. We are a fun-loving, mind-blowing company that makes a difference one cup at a time. 
Position OverviewThe Senior IT Project Manager is responsible for leading and managing complex IT projects from start to finish. This position will work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, engineers, QA analysts, designers, and business stakeholders, to ensure project objectives are met within scope, budget, and timeline. All activities will be performed in support of the strategy, vision, and values of Dutch Bros.
Location Requirement: This position is based in Phoenix, AZ and is not eligible for remote work. ﻿
Key Result Areas (KRAs)Ensures that a portfolio of projects are executed efficiently and effectively, with a focus on delivering projects on time, within budget, and to the satisfaction of stakeholder:Be outcome and benefit driven, identifying and realizing benefits and, prioritizing project delivery to meet business priorities.Understand client requirements and have the ability to design comprehensive strategies for achieving successful project outcomes.Collaborate with stakeholders to clarify project requirements to build statements of work.Communicate project progress, risks, and issues to stakeholders, and ensure that stakeholders are informed and engaged throughout the project lifecycle.Manage project budgets, including forecasting and tracking project costs, and ensuring that projects are resourced appropriately to deliver on time and within budget.Ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards, including security and data privacy requirements.Coordinate project testing, deployment, and post-implementation activities, ensuring successful project delivery and that lessons learned are applied to future projects.
Collaborate with IT staff and project stakeholders to effectively communicate project expectations and status in a timely and concise manner:Develop and deliver presentations to key stakeholders as needed.Participate in the strategic planning activities for the assigned area.Hold and/or attend regular project status meetings, vendor presentations, and teleconferences associated with assigned projects.Develop strong partnerships and work with peer levels of management to resolve resource conflicts.Negotiate and manage vendor contracts, ensuring that contract terms and conditions are fair, clear, and enforceable and that vendors are held accountable for meeting their contractual obligations.Mentor and train junior project managers and provide guidance and support to project team members
Champion continuous improvement in project management processes and practices, and ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards: Work with business partners to optimize cross-departmental processes and improve system automation to scale workflows.Identify and implement relevant tools and technologies that can help streamline project management processes and improve project outcomes.Champion a culture of continuous improvement within the project management team, encouraging team members to share ideas and feedback.Assess and benchmark project management practices against industry standards and best practices to identify areas for improvement.Communicate effectively and independently across the organization at the executive level and outside the organization.Work through and escalate issues that serve as roadblocks and/or place project objectives at risk. 
Job QualificationsBachelor’s degree in business management, computer science, or related field 6 additional years of experience in IT project management, with a proven track record of delivering complex projects on time and within budgetStrong technical background in IT infrastructure, including knowledge of network architecture, server infrastructure, cloud technologies, cybersecurity, and IT operationsExperience implementing IT infrastructure solutions, including network topologies, storage solutions, and server configurations, while considering scalability and securityExperience in managing software development projects for applications released through app stores such as Google Play or the Apple App storeExperience managing vendors for IT projects, including selecting vendors, negotiating contracts, and ensuring that vendors deliver their services on time and within budgetExperience in managing change, including creating change management processes and communicating changes to stakeholders, minimizing the impact of change to business operationsKnowledge of project management methodologies, including agile, waterfall, and hybrid approachesExperience using project management tools and software, such as Jira, Trello, or WrikePMP certification or equivalent

SkillsChange ManagementCollaborationCommunicationFinancial ManagementLeadershipPresentationsProject ManagementRisk ManagementStakeholder ManagementTechnical Knowledge
Physical RequirementsOccasionally move or lift office items Must be able to work in an office environment Must be able to communicate in an effective manner to perform job dutiesConstantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as calculators, copy machines, computers, and office equipment
If you like wild growth and working in a unique and fun environment, surrounded by positive community, you'll enjoy your career with us!

title: Director of Finance
description:
As the Director of Finance for a $32 million organization, the incumbent leads financial process optimization and compliance efforts, implementing innovative technologies and providing strategic analysis to drive informed decision-making. Lead and mentor a skilled team, fostering a culture of leadership and technology adoption while ensuring smooth operations. Prepare comprehensive financial reports, lead the annual budget process, and oversee external audits and tax returns, maintaining strict compliance with accounting principles and laws. Spearhead the development and execution of funding large-scale capital projects, collaborating with stakeholders to ensure alignment with organizational goals and financial objectives. Uphold ethical standards, establish and maintain effective controls, documentation, and legal compliance measures to safeguard the organization's integrity.  Receives supervision from the Executive Director of the University of Kansas Memorial Union Corporation. Position has responsibility for management of a staff of up to four full time and part-time employees. 
This position will be posted and accepting applications through May 10, 2024, or until filled. Questions can be directed to unionhr@ku.edu.  Financial Leadership: Lead financial process optimization and compliance efforts, overseeing routine tasks like month-end journal entries and reconciliations. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement new technologies for enhanced efficiency company wide. Provide strategic analysis and recommendation to drive informed decision-making while maintaining compliance with documented procedures. Identify efficiencies in reporting and processes throughout the company and beyond the business office. Managing People: Manage, recruit, and train a business office and IT resources. Delegate tasks effectively to ensure smooth and efficient operations. Foster a culture of leadership and technology adoption within the team in a collaborative atmosphere. Organization Support: Prepare comprehensive financial reports for the organization’s board of directors or executive committee. Provide insightful financial analysis, including comparisons against budget and prior years, to support decision-making. Conduct regular meetings with department leadership to suggest improvements and discuss strategic initiatives. Leads the annual budget process for an effective and timely execution. Problem-Solving: Prepare schedules for external audits and tax returns. Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure compliance and effective audits. Interpret, implement, and maintain corporate financial processes to comply with accounting principles and governmental laws. Leads the company IT strategy to provide effective hardware and systems to employee base. Effectively manage the identified ERP system, ensuring it remains cost-effective and meets business needs. Planning & Organization: Lead: Lead the development and execution of a comprehensive capital plan for a large-scale renovation project, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and financial objectives. Collaborate with key stakeholders to assess project feasibility, establish budgets, and secure necessary funding sources. Oversee the implementation of the capital plan, including project milestones, timelines, and resource allocation. Monitor project progress, manage risks, and provide regular updates to senior leadership and the board of directors. Evaluate the financial impact of the renovation project and make strategic recommendations to optimize resource allocation and ensure long-term sustainability. Business Ethics: Establish and maintain effective controls and audit capabilities, documenting policies and standard operating procedures effectively. Track management and policy documents, legal agreements, contracts, and ensure general legal compliance. Provide leadership in risk management, insurance, and liability safeguards. 
Required Qualifications:1. Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field. 2. Minimum of 5 years of experience in financial management or related roles. 3. Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial analysis techniques. 4. Demonstrated experience in leading and managing a team. 5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels. 6. Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Office Suite. 7. Experience in capital planning and funding. 
Preferred Qualifications:1. Master's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field. 2. CPA (Certified Public Accountant) or CMA (Certified Management Accountant) certification. 3. Experience working in a higher education or nonprofit organization. 4. Familiarity with enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems; implementation and effective utilization. 5. Experience with project management methodologies. 6. Demonstrated success in implementing innovative financial technologies or processes. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:1. Leadership: Ability to lead financial process optimization efforts and foster a culture of leadership within the team. 2. Financial Analysis: Proficiency in conducting financial analysis and providing strategic recommendations. 3. Compliance: Strong understanding of accounting principles and laws to ensure compliance. 4. Project Management: Experience in planning and executing large-scale capital projects, including budgeting and resource allocation. 5. Communication: Excellent communication skills to effectively communicate financial information to stakeholders. 6. Ethics: Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining effective controls to safeguard organizational integrity.

title: Plant Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Plant Manager who can meet the demands of a dynamic and rapidly expanding multi-brand food manufacturing company. The ideal candidate will lead and drive operational excellence, ensuring the overall efficiency of our plant, and helping us achieve our strategic goal of increasing sales 10 times in 3 years. About UsNorthwest Frozen is a Seattle-based, Founder-led, forward-thinking food manufacturing company, dedicated to redefining the culinary landscape with our innovative approach to food production. Our commitment to innovation and quality has propelled us to the forefront of the market. We are proud to be at the cutting edge of technology, continuously pushing the boundaries to develop new, exciting, and nutritious food products. Whether it's pioneering new ingredients, cooking techniques, or packaging designs, we strive to make a positive impact on the world's food industry. We operate the largest sushi factory in North America, producing over one million pieces of sushi daily for national and international grocery chains. Apart from sushi, we offer restaurant-quality frozen and fresh ready meals. In 2024, we are launching new product lines that will revolutionize the fresh and frozen food industry. We are driven by ambitious goals, fast execution, and a strong sense of urgency. Join us if you want to shape the next generation of frozen and fresh ready meals! Our TeamAt Northwest Frozen, our team is our most valuable asset! We foster an environment that encourages creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning, which makes our workplace exciting and dynamic. As we continue to expand and grow our company, we are looking for an experienced Plant Manager to join our energetic, diverse, and talented team and contribute to our collective success. The PositionYou will report directly to the CEO and Founder of the Company and be responsible for overseeing all aspects of plant operations, ensuring production efficiency while maintaining a safe and compliant working environment. This is a key leadership role that requires a deep understanding of food manufacturing, strong management skills, and a passion for driving operational efficiency through continuous improvements. Key Responsibilities & TasksYou will be responsible for the areas covering Procurement, Logistics, Inventory, Production, and Maintenance, and be working cross-functional with HR, R&D, QA, and Sales.
 Your primary responsibilities and tasks will include:Production Management: Lead and manage the production team to ensure efficient and on-time manufacturing of food products while maintaining quality standards. Develop and implement production schedules, ensuring efficient utilization of resources and labor.Production Performance (KPIs) & Process Optimization: Establish and lead essential Production KPIs to continuously monitor and improve the performance of our production process to enhance productivity and reduce cost and waste.Resource Allocation: Allocate resources effectively, including personnel, equipment, and materials, to meet production goals and budgets.Quality Control: Implement and maintain quality control measures to ensure our products meet regulatory and internal quality standards.Inventory Management: Oversee and optimize inventory control, including raw materials, work-in-progress, packaging materials, and finished products.Maintenance Management: Oversee and support the Maintenance Manager and the maintenance team to ensure maximum uptime of all plant equipment.Safety and Compliance: Leading and ensuring that all safety requirements are met and that a culture of safety is maintained in the production facility. Ensure that the facility operates in compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.Team Development: Develop, coach, and mentor production staff to create a high-performing team.Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on production performance (KPIs) and trends to CEO.
About You – Skills & QualificationsYou are an energetic, result-oriented leader with a proven track record of successfully driving production performance and optimization to achieve measurable results. You have extensive experience in implementing process improvements that resulted in increased productivity, reduced cost, and waste, and enhanced overall efficiency.
We are seeking someone who embodies the following skills and qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience requiredProven work experience in food manufacturing operations managementExcellent problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to identify issues and develop effective solutionsStrong communication and interpersonal skills are essential! You can effectively communicate with team members and other stakeholders, ensuring everyone is aligned with production goals.Proficient in implementing and using production management software and toolsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing circumstancesExcellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team to achieve production targets and operational excellenceYou have experience in safety regulations and compliance in order to maintain a culture of safetyAbility to work independently and as part of a team, with a strong sense of accountability and ownership
Join UsIf you are a forward-thinking, driven, and passionate individual who is ready to be part of an innovative food manufacturing company, Northwest Frozen is the place for you!
Please apply here or by providing your resume directly to our HR Team: HR@nwfrozen.com Interview ProcessAfter you submit your application, our team will review your CV and your statement of exceptional work. If your application clears the initial review, you will be invited to a 15-minute phone interview where a team member will ask you some basic questions. If you pass this phone interview, you will proceed to the main selection process, which includes four technical interviews:• Three 1-on-1 interviews focusing on work ethic, career goals, and motivations. • A team interview, where you will meet more team members and deliver a 20-minute presentation on the most challenging technical problems you have solved.We aim to complete this process within one week.  We do not use recruiters for assessments. All applications are evaluated by our Founder and CEO. All interviews will be conducted via Google Meet. We Offer We offer the following employee benefits:• Competitive cash and an annual bonus based on company revenues • Medical, dental, and vision insurance• Paid time off• Visa sponsorship for new hires (if applicable) Annual Base Salary: $160,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year Position location: Des Moines, WA Start Date: ImmediateJob Type: Full-timeSchedule: Monday to FridayWork Location: In person.

title: Booker - Rolls-Royce, Bentley, Aston Martin, Ineos
description:
Holman is a family-owned, global automotive services organization anchored by our deeply rooted core values and principles that have enabled us to continue Driving What’s Right throughout the last century. title: Group Controller
description:
SSW Advanced Technologies, LLC is a growing multinational supplier to the global appliance OEMs. With more than 70 years of expertise and innovation, we design and sell components and systems to the residential appliance industry (refrigeration, cooking, laundry), commercial refrigeration, HVAC, retail display and home/office organizational markets. More information is available on our website https://www.sswtechnologies.com/
Job descriptionThe Group Controller will be responsible for overseeing financial statements like balance sheets, invoices, accounts payable and accounts receivable. Their duties include providing standardization and guidance to division controllers, compiling consolidated financial reports based on financial statements and implementing policies and procedures for financial reporting.
Primary Responsibilities:Assist the Corporate Controller in strategic financial, accounting, and operational projects.Assist the Corporate Controller in organizational learning initiatives.Provide support and alignment to site controllers and different divisions.Audit the proper operation of the Accounting Department, which include inventory transactions and accounts, accounts payable, accounts receivable, bank reconciliations, and payroll.Oversees training programs and identifies training needs.Travels as necessary to support systems/metric/control/process implementation at any SSW Facility and perform internal auditing process.Perform month-end closing monitoring activities and reviews maintenance of an accurate general ledger.Demonstrated strength in overall general ledger accounting and reconciliation aptitudes with emphasis on ensuring a clean balance sheet and accurate income statements.Prepare, examine, or analyze accounting records, financial statements, or other financial reports to assess accuracy, completeness, and conformance to reporting and procedural standards.Appraise, evaluate, and inventory real property and equipment, recording information such as the description, value, and location of property. Compute federal taxes owed and prepare tax returns in alignment with tax advisors, ensuring compliance with payment, reporting, or other tax requirements.Development of control matrices to effectively monitor contractual obligations contained in legal agreements and develop audit to compliance.Be available for extended travel assignments to sister facilities for learning, training and meeting purposes.Responsible for Accounting and Reporting functions as assigned.Assist in rollout and stabilization of ERP solutions.Support in documenting working instructions and guidelines.

title: Chief of Staff
description:
**Compensation: $120,000-170,000 USD annually; FULLY REMOTE**We do not provide sponsorship at this time. 
What You'll Do:As Chief of Staff, you'll be a key member of our executive team, working directly with the company president to drive the execution of our strategic initiatives. Your day-to-day will range from managing complex programs such as international expansion and pricing & packaging analysis, to crafting our quarterly board decks and all-hands materials. You'll participate in strategic planning sessions, work closely with the executive team and wear many hats, acting as a strategic advisor, project manager, and internal consultant across all levels of leadership.

Key Responsibilities:Strategic Execution: Initiate the planning, execution, and delivery of key initiatives, ensuring they align with our company's strategic goals. You'll tackle projects of all sizes, turning vision into action.
Communication Hub: Own the creation of compelling and clear materials for board meetings, company-wide presentations, external stakeholders and more. You will be at the center of information flowing throughout the organization, while interfacing with internal teams, external partners, investors and more. Your knack for storytelling will keep everyone aligned, informed and engaged.
Leadership Liaison: Act as a bridge between the president and other departments; ensuring smooth communication, alignment on priorities and a consistent feedback loop. You’ll have the authority to make decisions as a proxy for the company president when needed.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with leaders across the company to foster a culture of transparency, efficiency, and shared success. Your ability to navigate complex organizational dynamics will be key.
Partnership and Business Development: Take a proactive role in managing and enhancing existing partner relationships. Your strategic insights will be crucial in identifying areas for growth and ensuring the success of ongoing collaborations. Focus on deepening these partnerships through continuous engagement and alignment with our strategic goals, facilitating a sustainable and mutually beneficial relationship.

Who You Are:A strategic thinker with an ability to execute. You're comfortable in the weeds but always have the big picture in mind.An exceptional communicator. You know how to craft a message that resonates, whether it's for the boardroom, the all-hands meeting or one-on-one with any member of our talented team.A trusted advisor. You're known for your judgment and ability to give sound advice under pressure.Agile and adaptable. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and can pivot with grace when priorities shift.A relationship builder. You excel at working across all levels of an organization and can manage external partnerships with ease.Resilient and reflective. You see setbacks as opportunities to learn and refine strategies. Your approach to failure is constructive, enabling you to lead with resilience and adaptability.

Qualifications:Proven track record in program management, strategic planning and execution.Exceptional leadership skills, with the ability to influence and drive initiatives forward.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.Strategic mindset, with a collaborative approach to working across departments.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a results-oriented mindset.Experience in Music and/or Tech a plus.
About DistroKid:Founded in 2013, DistroKid distributes 30-40% of all new music in the world. They have built their business on providing musicians, managers, and record labels with online tools and services that are innovative, easy to use, and affordable. More than 2 million artists rely on DistroKid, including hobbyists, up-and-coming musicians, top influencers, and international stars. DistroKid’s expanding array of services includes music distribution, monetization, metadata customization, storage, and promotion. DistroKid’s small staff, coupled with a largely automated backend, has enabled DistroKid to process nearly 45 million songs, while simultaneously providing fast, personal & friendly customer service to artists of every size. Also, it’s fun to work here. :)
For more information, visit https://distrokid.comDistroKid is an Equal Opportunity employer.

title: Senior Internal Auditor
description:
Partnership Employment has partnered with a Fortune 500 company in Irving, TX and we are seeking a Senior Internal Auditor with 3-5 years experience for a Direct Hire job opportunity. This is a wonderful job opportunity, with great benefits, and an amazing leadership team. Additional job requirements are below: 
Functional Responsibilities: • Successfully performs audits of dealership operations and corporate functions to evaluate conformance with GAAP, laws, regulations and company policy in an economical and timely manner • Successfully leads reviews of organizational and functional activities, audits of third parties and investigations as assigned, in a timely manner • Successfully documents and evaluates the design and effectiveness of key controls supporting management’s opinion of internal controls over financial reporting at both the corporate and dealership levels, in a timely manner • Successfully plans and executes audits in accordance with IIA professional practices • Successfully performs dealership audits, including F&I variable audits, operational audits, resale certificate audits, accounting office audits, and auction audits, etc. • Successfully performs SOX testing, and assists the Company’s External Auditor with annual SOC Evaluations, and the vehicle inventory and parts inventory observation processes • Reports audit findings and makes appropriate, well thought out, value-added recommendations for correcting unsatisfactory conditions, improving processes, and reducing costs, in a clear, concise, and effective manner • Maintains effective working relationships with executive and operating management • Effectively plans the approach and scope of audits, including designing specific audit steps, to focus on high risk areas, and determining alternative methods needed to address theft or other serious issues • Determines the auditing procedures to be used, including the use of computer-assisted audit techniques • Determines alternative methods to test or review when audit results indicate that there may be reporting, theft, or other serious issues • Successfully obtains, analyzes, and appraises evidentiary data as a basis for an informed, objective opinion on the adequacy and effectiveness of the system of internal controls, in an accurate and timely manner • Successfully makes, or assists in making, oral or written presentations to management during and at the conclusion of the examination, including discussing deficiencies, recommending corrective actions, and suggesting improvements in operations and reductions in cost • Very proficient in preparing detailed workpapers meeting the Corporate Audit team’s standards for preparing audit and SOX testing workpapers • Successfully prepares formal written reports expressing opinions on the adequacy and effectiveness of the system of internal controls, in a timely manner • Appraises the adequacy of the corrective action taken to implement recommendations • Coordinates audit fieldwork in an economical manner• Assists with training new department personnel • Successfully, conducts Operational Walkthroughs of certain functional areas on behalf of the Company’s External Auditor, as needed, in a timely manner • Provides risk and controls feedback to management regarding system implementations underway • Helps to educate management and key functional area contacts on risks, controls, and SOX testing • Makes value added recommendations to management to help them achieve their organizational objectives • Assists with Quality Assessment Reviews (QARs) on a periodic basis, as needed • Successfully works with management to help ensure they are aware of SOX controls updates by Corporate management for the current year • Effectively manages and completes all assignments and projects in a timely manner 
Requirements: • Undergraduate degree in accounting or a Master’s degree in accounting with a different major for bachelor’s degree • Active CPA Certificate/License or Current Candidate; or Active CIA Certification or Current Candidate • Three-year minimum internal audit or equivalent experience • Verified current knowledge and verified current understanding of internal auditing, accounting, financial, and operational controls, and keeps current on technical developments in the field • Experience with information technology general controls, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and Institute of Internal Auditors Professional Practices Framework • Experience with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) documentation and testing • Verified Attention to detail • Verified effective communicator, (both oral and written), which includes proper English, proper pronunciation and enunciation (writing sample will be required) • Communicates audit results and recommendations in a clear, concise, and very effective manner • Proficient in understanding ERP systems and incorporating this knowledge into conducting effective audits in areas utilizing such systems • Proficient in effectively utilizing computer-assisted audit techniques in conducting audit and review procedures • Proficient in using Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Outlook, and in using spreadsheets, and the ability to learn other systems such as IDEA and Workiva • Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and work well with clients, including executive and operational management, to obtain cooperation, to get questions answered, and to obtain needed supporting documentation all in a timely manner • Willing to travel up to 50% 
Pay & Recognition: • Weekly pay • Paid holidays and paid time off • Paid training • Stock Awards(select management and front-line team member’s eligible!) Insurance/Retirement: • Insurance: medical, vision, dental, accident, critical illness and hospital indemnity plans • Up to 8 weeks paid pregnancy leave (disability leave) • Health savings • Flex spending accounts (tax free) • Short-term and Long-term disability plans • Life Insurance (Whole Life and Term) • 401k with company match Learning, 
Tuition Assistance and Career Development: • Digital career path tool to assist with career development • Continuous training through Asbury's Internal Learning Management System • Professional growth and development opportunities Additional Advantages: • Student loan relief resources • Employee assistance program • Employee discounts on vehicle purchases, parts and service repairs • Scholarship awards • Opportunities to join our community service initiatives • Aggressive Employee referral program with bonus opportunities 
If you or anyone you know in your network is open to hear more about this job opportunity please apply or send your resume directly to lgarcia@partnershipemployment.com

description:

title: Enterprise Sales Representative
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Job Title: Enterprise Sales Representative Company: Golden Pacific Logistics
Location: Long Beach, CA
Job Type: Full-time, on-site
About Golden Pacific Logistics:Golden Pacific Logistics is a dynamic transportation brokerage committed to delivering exceptional service to our customers through old-fashioned grit and a hyper-focus on their needs. As a new brokerage, we embrace an "all hands on deck" approach to building strong relationships with both customers and carriers to ensure the highest level of service and net revenue margin.
Position Overview:We are seeking a motivated and experienced Enterprise Sales Representative to join our team and play a pivotal role in driving the growth of our business. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a proven track record of success in enterprise sales, particularly within the transportation or logistics industry. They will be responsible for identifying, prospecting, and closing new business opportunities while leveraging existing relationships to maximize net revenue and foster long-term partnerships.
Key Responsibilities:- Develop and execute a strategic sales plan to achieve and exceed revenue targets within assigned territory or verticals.- Identify and prioritize key accounts and prospects for business development efforts.- Build and maintain strong relationships with decision-makers at prospective and existing customers.- Collaborate closely with the operations team to ensure smooth onboarding and ongoing support for customers.- Negotiate pricing and contractual agreements to maximize net revenue margin while delivering value to customers.- Stay abreast of industry trends, market dynamics, and competitive landscape to identify opportunities and mitigate risks.- Provide regular reporting and insights on sales performance, pipeline development, and market trends.
Qualifications:- Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or related field.- Minimum of 5-7 years of enterprise sales experience, preferably in the transportation or logistics industry.- Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth.- Strong network of contacts and relationships within the transportation or logistics industry.- Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and adapt to change.- Proficiency in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite.
Why Join Us:At Golden Pacific Logistics, we offer a unique opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing company that is reshaping the transportation brokerage landscape. You will have the autonomy to make a meaningful impact and the support of a dedicated team committed to your success. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and a collaborative work environment where your ideas are valued and recognized.
If you are passionate about sales, relationship-building, and driving business growth, we want to hear from you! Join us in delivering exceptional service to our customers and achieving the highest net revenue margin in the industry. Apply now to embark on an exciting journey with Golden Pacific Logistics.

title: Assistant Buyer
description: Travel Traders, LLC is seeking an Assistant Buyer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for the travel retail industry and excellent analytical, communication, and negotiation skills. As an Assistant Buyer, you will assist the Buyer in purchasing and managing inventory, exploiting key relationships, and meeting financial targets for our over 200 stores in upscale hotels nationwide.  Key Responsibilities: · Assist the Buyer in identifying and selecting products that meet company standards and goals for the retail travel industry.· Develop and grow partnerships with external suppliers and store teams to source relevant products and negotiate and secure the best terms and conditions of purchase. · Analyze sales data and market trends to determine inventory needs and adjust purchases accordingly.· Responsible for all assortment files and product illustrations, including national, regional, store layouts, space allocation, plan-o-grams, and re-orderable assortments. · Responsible for creating, distributing, and coordinating communication to the field, including system messages, memos, promotional calendars, product knowledge, and conference calls.· Submits system updates, price changes, and promotions to the Retail Data Control Team within the appropriate lead times.· Maintains accurate files related to, but not limited to, cost files, price changes, UPC updates, and assortment files. · Develops and grows critical internal relationships with the stores, accounts payable, and retail data control teams to ensure file integrity and meet business goals.  Qualifications: · A degree in business, marketing, or a related field preferred· 2+ years of experience in buying or procurement, preferably in the retail travel industry.· Excellent analytical, communication, problem-solving, organizational, and prioritization skills are necessary.· Proficient in Microsoft Office with skills with emphasis on Excel with VLookup and Pivot Tables· Passion for the travel retail industry and industry trends Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. title: Pond and Lake Maintenance - Regional Manager
description:

All other duties as assigned by the Branch Manager. Aptitude to work outside for long periods of time in unfavorable conditions.Willingness to travel to assist other branches with notice..Systems-oriented.Results-driven.Possesses core values compatible with those of Dragonfly Pond Works ((Quality Focus, Take Ownership and Growth Oriented).

title: Acumatica Consultant - Generalist (Remote)
description:
Description

Position at Net at Work

About Net at Work:

Net at Work provides next-generation technology solutions and services that enable our clients to unleash the power of their businesses. These solutions are customized to meet the demands of specific industries through the integration of best-of-breed applications. With expertise in finance, accounting, operations, workforce management, and customer experience, Net at Work serves as a trusted advisor, helping small- and mid-sized businesses keep pace with the competition, win new customers, improve profitability, and thrive in the digital economy.

Having started with just two employees, Net at Work is now more than 300 employees strong, and we are still growing. We are looking to expand our team with experienced professionals who share our core values and are problem solvers, promise keepers, collaborative integrators, inspiring coaches and driven intrapreneurs.

Position Overview:

Net at Work is looking to hire an Acumatica Consultant. The Acumatica Consultant’s role is to plan, design, develop, and launch efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions as well as assist with upgrades, training, and support for the Acumatica solution. The business analyst works directly with customers to identify business requirements with sufficient detail and clarity to allow technical solution proposal development and deployment as well as use their problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve systems issues in order to maximize the benefit of Acumatica system investments. Additionally, the business analyst will work with other consultants, customer service, and sales team to develop and close services projects and maintain customer relationships to ensure customer satisfaction and ease of on-going support.

Job Responsibilities:

Serves as Business Analyst for clients Acumatica implementations, leading project teams in defining, planning, and implementing the Acumatica solution.Have a strong working knowledge of ERP business software.Have professional exposure in business workflow.Have experience with product implementations.Project management experience in utilizing appropriate tools and resources to document processes, timelines, and responsibilities. Solid communication skills with good follow-up and follow-through on assigned tasks and responsibilities to timeline.Provide friendly phone, on-line, and on-site consulting services for our clients using Acumatica software (ERP).Works with customers to achieve the best solutions for customer to maximize product use, benefits, and functionalityDevelops and executes a challenging and interesting self-education and professional development plan.Perform other duties as assigned.Travel 20% required


Job Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in accounting or computer science, information technology, quality assurance, or equivalent strongly preferredMinimum of 5 plus years of experience using ERP solutions (i.e. Epicor, Dynamics AX, Sage or similar ERP software).3 plus year experience implementing Acumatica ERP solutions.Understanding of operational processes and requirements in the ERP world, including but not limited to distribution and/or manufacturing with a functional competency in accounting, quote to cash, procure to play, operations, e-commerce or CRM functions highly desired.Experience in providing support related to product demonstrations and assisting in needs analysis and solution recommendations.Experience with project scoping, planning, requirements gathering, business process mapping and end-to-end process experience desired.Experience in utilizing defined and structured implementation processes and project management methodologies desired.Experience with Manufacturing, Field-Service, Project/Construction, Payroll modules a plus


Core Competencies:

Communication Skills: Communicates well one-on-one, in small groups and public speaking. Keeps people informed. Writes clear, precise, well-organized documents using appropriate vocabulary, grammar, and word usage.

Analysis: Identifies significant problems and opportunities. Analyzes problems and people in depth. Determines root causes and offers appropriate solutions.

Customer Focused: Monitors client satisfaction and establishes partner relationship with clients. Visible and accessible to clients.

Pragmatism: Generates sensible, realistic, and practical solutions to projects.

Base [salary range] : $100,000 to $130,000.

This position is also eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the Company’s plan.

Please note that the quoted pay range for this job is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) experience, including industry or product specific experience, education, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, and/or other applicable laws.

We provide competitive, affordable, and diverse benefit programs that support your total health – from healthy body to healthy mind. These benefits support you and your family in all aspects of life:

Health and Welfare (Medical, Dental, Vision)Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity Employee Assistance Program (EAP)Life and AD&D InsuranceShort- and Long-Term Disability InsuranceFlexible Spending AccountsTransportation and Parking AccountsHealth Savings Accounts (with company contribution)Retirement Planning (401k with matching contribution)Legal BenefitsIdentity Theft ProtectionPet InsuranceWellness Program OfferingsPaid Time Off, accrued per pay period based on years of service starting at 15 days annually. 8 Paid Holidays per year, including 1 floating holiday.


The compensation and benefits information is accurate of the date of this posting and subject to plan eligibility. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law.

The Company expects to accept applications for this position until May 30, 2024 but encourages interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. We will review this information and one of our Talent Acquisition professionals will reach out if your background aligns to the positions.

EOE/Diversity & Inclusion Statement

Net at Work is dedicated to unleashing the power and potential of our employees and teams by creating a vibrant and inclusive workplace where each employee can be their best. We are committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. Net at Work is a proud equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions at Net at Work are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: Events and Sponsorships Manager (Remote)
description:
Description

Position at Net at Work

About Net at Work:

Net at Work provides next-generation technology solutions and services that enable our clients to unleash the power of their businesses. These solutions are customized to meet the demands of specific industries through the integration of best-of-breed applications. With expertise in finance, accounting, operations, workforce management, and customer experience, Net at Work serves as a trusted advisor, helping small- and mid-sized businesses keep pace with the competition, win new customers, improve profitability, and thrive in the digital economy.

Position Overview:

Net at Work is seeking a dynamic, experienced Events Manager to spearhead our event management across various business units. This role is pivotal in driving our brand presence through meticulously planned and executed corporate events, sponsorships, and industry trade shows. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in event planning, brand management, and sponsorship program execution.

Key Responsibilities:

 Event Planning and Management: Lead the planning, coordination, and execution of all corporate events, including a variety C-level events, webinars, and company-sponsored events. Collaborate and coordinate with multiple business units to ensure events are aligned with and will influence each unit's revenue goals and objectives. Manage all aspects of event coordination including venue selection, vendor management and negotiation, budgeting, event registration, logistics, timelines, on-site management, and post-event follow-up.  Sponsorship Program Management: Develop and manage a comprehensive third-party sponsorship program that aligns with Net at Work’s strategic goals. Identify, recruit, and secure potential sponsorship opportunities that align with Net at Work's branding and marketing strategies. Negotiate agreements with vendors and venues. Foster and maintain relationships with sponsors, ensuring mutual benefits and long-term partnerships. Coordinate with sponsors to ensure fulfillment of contractual obligations and maximum visibility.  Trade Show Participation and Branding: Oversee Net at Work’s participation in industry trade shows, including booth design, staffing, marketing, and promotional materials, ensuring a strong and effective brand presence. Coordinate booth design, marketing materials, and promotional items to effectively represent the company. Stay abreast of industry trends and technology to ensure Net at Work’s presence is innovative and impactful. Engage with attendees, network, and generate leads to support business growth. Manage schedule of mini-theaters, identify, prep, and conduct session dry-runs for speakers at conferences.  Communications: Drive communications across company on corporate activities and events. Work with Business Unit leaders and the Marketing team to distribute email, social, and VIP communications. Maintain internal events calendar and events information on Net at Work’s websites including post-event results and lessons learned.  Branding and Marketing:  Ensure consistent and effective branding across all events.Collaborate with the marketing team to develop event-related marketing materials and campaigns. Utilize digital and traditional marketing strategies to enhance event visibility and attendance. Identify co-marketing opportunities for event sponsors including signage, guerilla promotional marketing.  Budget Management: 



 Develop and manage budgets for all events and sponsorship activities.Monitor expenses and provide regular (weekly, monthly, and quarterly) financial reports to the CMO on events ROI. Performance Measurement: Implement metrics to measure the success and ROI of events and sponsorship programs. Develop and implement satisfaction surveys on leads and event execution for Business Units and key stakeholders. Provide comprehensive reports on event outcomes, attendee feedback, and ROI. Make recommendations for future improvements. 


Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Communications, Event Management, or a related field.  Proven track record in managing large-scale events and sponsorship programs.At least 5 years of experience in event planning and management, preferably in a technology and B2B environment.  Prior experience with a CRM, ERP, or HR software company a plus.Prior experience in managing an events team including contractor and vendor resources. Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to handle multiple events simultaneously.  Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.  Strong negotiation and vendor management skills.  Energetic and enthusiastic personality with a can-do attitude. title: Assistant Professor of Finance
description:
Rhode Island College invites applicants for the position of Assistant Professor of Finance. This is a continuing tenure-track, academic year, full-time position. The position is open until filled. The search committee will begin reviewing applications on April 22, 2024 and priority will be given to applications submitted by that date. First-round interviews will be conducted on Zoom during the last week of April 2024. We expect campus interviews to take place in May, and an offer out no later than June 15, 2024.
The Department of Economics and Finance is housed in the School of Business with the Departments of Accounting, Computer Information Systems, and Management and Marketing. The Department has approximately 150 majors, served by six full-time faculty members, and offers around 50 course sections per year. Class size is limited to a maximum of 30 students. About 1,000 students major in the School of Business programs. The programs offered by the Department of Economics and Finance include majors in economics and finance, and minors in economics, finance, and international business. The Department is a Bloomberg Experiential Learning Partner (ELP) and the Finance Lab houses 15 Bloomberg terminals. The BS in Finance degree has the CFA Institute University Affiliation Program designation and the CFA Institute Level I Exam curriculum is embedded in several of the finance courses.
Rhode Island College (RIC) is a regional comprehensive public college that serves approximately 5,000 students through its five schools: Faculty of Arts and Sciences, School of Education and Human Development, School of Business, School of Nursing, and School of Social Work. Established in 1854, RIC is Rhode Island’s first public institution of higher education. The College is located on a beautiful 180-acre suburban campus in the vibrant city of Providence, Rhode Island’s capital, with excellent proximity to the academic and cultural resources of Boston and New York City. 
The College boasts engaged faculty, high-quality academic programs, small class sizes, personalized, hands-on learning experiences, and high value-to-tuition compared to other four-year institutions. Committed to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion and providing a safe and inclusive campus environment for all students, the College is proud to be a Hispanic-Serving Institution (HSI). With first-generation students making up about half its student body, RIC is dedicated to providing students with a well-rounded college experience to facilitate upward mobility and career growth. The college offers an active campus life, including clubs and organizations, athletics, cultural events, and community service opportunities. 
ResponsibilitiesTeaching undergraduate finance courses,Conducting and publishing research in finance,Involvement in activities that promote student development and growth, including advising and working with student teams/organizations,Providing service to the department, college, and community,Performing other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Chair of the Economics and Finance Department.
QualificationsCandidates must have a Ph.D. (or DBA) in Finance or a Ph.D. in a related field accompanied with an earned CFA Charter. ABD with completion expected by June 2024 will be considered; however, a doctoral degree is required for all tenure-track appointments and must be completed prior to the beginning of service.
College level teaching experience in finance, commitment to teaching excellence, and demonstrated potential for scholarly research are required. The successful candidate is expected to serve actively within the department and the College. This service will include advising finance majors and minors, and excellence in advising and mentoring students is highly sought. Candidates from all areas of finance are welcome to apply.

title: Project Manager (PM Level 1), Housing For Health, Office of Managed Care (Central Office)
description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals 

Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible

NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Job Description

Housing for Health (HFH) at NYC Health + Hospitals (H+H) recognizes that the chronic health issues of unhoused individuals cannot be treated without stable housing. This initiative seeks to improve the health and wellbeing of New Yorkers by focusing on four strategic areas: housing navigation services, medical respite beds, affordable housing on hospital property, and social service support for patients in permanent housing.

Under the direction of the Senior Project Manager, the Project Manager will be responsible for supporting the Housing for Health team to facilitate permanent housing placements for patients experiencing homelessness and support our medical respite program.

Coordination

General tasks and responsibilities include but not limited to:

 Perform patient intake for Housing Location and Placement Services initiative to provide patients experiencing homelessness with one-on-one support to fund a permanent home. This includes reviewing H+H facility referrals to Housing for Health to confirm patient’s eligibility; liaising with referral sources for additional patient information and consent; and matching patient to partners for Housing Location and Placement Services. Coordinate with H+H facilities personnel, nonprofit entities, government agencies, and housing providers to support patients housing placement. Program and project management for other housing, medical respite, and real estate initiatives as assigned.

Data Analysis

 Day to day data management of the General Housing Intake Tracker, H+H’s centralized platform for housing referrals and placements. This includes analysis and reporting to monitor contract performance and goals; matching patients to housing opportunity; identification of patient housing barriers; and data clean up. Merge and parse data sets supplied by all Housing for Health programs efficiently and be comfortable transforming dirty big data into actionable knowledge. Communicate analyses clearly to lay audiences and use analysis to drive progress towards H+H housing goals with facility partners, external entities, and the Housing Location and Placement Services and medical respite vendors. Utilize data analysis to drive coordination and policy creation with internal stakeholders, contracted vendors, government agencies, and housing providers. Assists in designing evaluative measures including data analysis and procedures by which program efficiency and costs effectiveness can be audited and assist in evaluation audits. Assist with tracking and data analysis for ad-hoc projects as assigned.

Miscellaneous

 Assist with the development of public materials, maintenance of the website, and responding to public inquiries. Perform research and other information gathering activities and prepare these materials for input into grant proposals, reports, and/or meetings and conferences. Support the Housing for Health teams needs across all programs as requested. Manage and assist with special projects as requested by Assistant Vice President and Senior Directors. This job description is not intended to be all inclusive, and employee will also perform reasonable related business duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

 A baccalaureate degree in engineering, architecture, landscape architecture, business administration or public administration from an accredited college or university; and one year of full-time satisfactory experience in project management work, such as planning, administrating, managing, coordinating or expediting for engineering and/or architectural and/or landscape architectural projects; or A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and five years of experience as described in “1” above; or A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent plus any combination of the experience and/or college education as described in “1” above to make up the equivalent of five years of education and experience. One year of credit will be given for each 30 semester credits of college education leading to a baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in engineering, architecture, landscape architecture, business administration or in public administration.

Special Note

 Experience which is primarily of a design nature is not acceptable towards meeting the minimum requirements.

 Department Preferences 

Preference will be given to qualified candidates with the following knowledge, abilities, education, experience and/or skills:

 New York City residency (Brooklyn, Bronx, Manhattan, Queens or Staten Island) preferred. Interest in housing and homelessness in a healthcare setting Experience with data analysis Excellent written and oral communication skills.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

 If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume. 

NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

 Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week  Retirement Savings and Pension Plans  Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees  Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts  College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities  Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Medical Lab Technician
description:
Welcome! We’re excited you’re considering an opportunity with us! To apply to this position and be considered, click the Apply button located above this message and complete the application in full. Below, you’ll find other important information about this position.    Perform and analyze clinical laboratory tests within scope of licensure in all laboratory disciplines by standard operating policies and procedures. Understand method principles, perform quality control, perform preventative maintenance, review, and analyze results as to accuracy, acceptability, and critical limits.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE:

1. Associates degree in Medical Laboratory or Laboratory Sciences (MLT).

2. Current WV, OH, PA or MD Licensure as a Medical Technician within 90 day of hire.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION, AND/OR LICENSURE:

1. Certification as a Medical Laboratory Technician (MLT) by the American Society of Clinical Pathologists (ASCP) or American Medical Technologists (AMT).

EXPERIENCE:

1. Experience as a Medical Laboratory Technician.

CORE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: The statements described here are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this position. They are not intended to be constructed as an all-inclusive list of all responsibilities and duties. Other duties may be assigned.

1. Process and analyze samples, in a timely and orderly fashion, and meet usual and customary levels of productivity, while following procedures for accurate identification.

2. Set up, run, maintain, and adjust laboratory instruments accordingly to policies and procedures.

3. Take appropriate action for quality control in all technical areas and follow infection control procedures for all job-related functions.

4. Perform phlebotomy procedures on patients as needed.

5. Complete forms and reports findings to nurses and/or physicians.

6. Interact with other healthcare workers to solve problems and interpret patient lab results within the framework of medical technology.

7. Perform routine and basic laboratory testing within a designated area in the clinical laboratory.

8. Recognize testing inconsistency and takes appropriate corrective action.

9. Maintain all patent and specimen records accurately, neatly, and legibly.

10. Follow hospital, state, and federal guidelines for ensuring a safe environment for workers, patients, and public.

11. Maintain compliance with hospital and departmental policies and procedures for safety, security, and infection control.

12. Communicate and interact with patients, families, visitors, physicians, departmental and hospital staff, and the public in general, in a manner that demonstrates professionalism and concern for their individual needs.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

1. Work requires strength and/or stamina, lifting, moving, stooping, reaching, standing, walking, and carrying of materials and equipment.

2. May sit for extended period of time.

 

WORKING ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 

1. Work around strong or unpleasant odors.

2. May be exposed to agents which may cause serious disease.

 

SKILLS AND ABILITIES: 

1. Able to multitask and handle stressful situations.

2. Able to communicate effectively.

3. Able to work well as a team with co-workers, supervisors and all other staff/customers, including patients.

4. Knowledge of basic computer skills.
